text: 12 ounce bottle thanks to Beerman6686. Pours a clean looking yellow. Big notes of lemon and tartness. Slightly floral. Nice.

12fl oz bottle poured into an English pint. Clear sparkling gold with a modest white head. Fruity aroma. Flavor is a blast of sour. 

Holy crap! I almost spit this out. My girlfriend poured this for me for a blind rate. I was not expecting that. Still, even after several sips, its incredibly sour. I didnt like this at first but it grew on me. Not a bad Berliner- never thought i would say that.

1. GF knows I am not a fan of Berliner weiss.
2. Dont give anyone a Berliner weiss blind. Ever.
3. Seriously. Who does that???
4. OK, do that if you want to laugh and youre an ass.
5. For real, I wish I had thought to do that.

2016 bottle. Aromas of white grapes, light malts, sweet corn, faint straw. Hazy golden pour with a foamy frothy white head. Flavors of white wine, chardonnay, tart grapes, white bread. Slight tart semi-dry pallate. The smoothest Berliner Weisse Ive had. Not my favorite style but well done.
2 Apr 2016, bottle. pale yellow and faintly hazy. nose is sweet, light lemon. crisp grape must, light lemon juice. pretty good on its own and would probably go well with berliner syrup.
Pale yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is citrus, lemon mainly. Taste is tart, little puckering. Very dry. Grain aftertaste is present but not dominating. Great lacing.

Very cloudy very light yellow pour, fairly effervescent, quarter inch or so of crisp white head. Aroma has subtle fig, strawberry, raspberry, some subtle waxy yeast. Average carbonation, frothy light mouthfeel and a slight bit tart, finished very crisp and dry. Flavor of tart fruits like raspberry, Apple and pear, lemongrass, hint of wheat.

12 oz. bottle from Discount Liquor, Milwaukee, WI. Yellowish-orange pour with a pillowy white head. Aroma of white wine, barnyard, and damp leather. Taste is pleasantly sour with fresh lemons and white grapes adding the acidic component while the underlying wheat balances the overall flavor. Perfect as a summer beer but it also works on this warm winters day. Easily surpasses any other Berliner Weisse I have tried.

Where: Shared as a gift from a neighbor. 
How: 12 ounce bottle.
Appearance: Hazy golden pour with a big, rocky, frothy white head. 
Aroma: Lemon, white wine, yeast. 
Taste: Slightly tart, fresh lemon, cereal malts. 
Palate: Fizzy. 
Overall: Others like this more than me but it was decent.
Straw yellow pour with white head. Aroma of wheat, grapes, and hint of tartness. Wheat flavor with white grape, and just a hint of tartness. Very nice beer.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a pale hazy gold with nice foamy white head. Aroma is lemon, yeast, floral on the nose. Taste is a nice mild tartness with flavors of lemon, pear, grapes, grass, sour funk. Overall very good for style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12 fl oz bottle at home, red foil top, no date or ABV details. Thanks to Scopey for the trade. Hazy dark yellow, sparkling, big foamy white head, full lacing. Aroma is plastic, lemon, a bit pissy, dried pineapple. Quite nice. Body is light, spritzy, a little foamy, tooth rot. Taste is sodawater with lemon juice, elderflower, background ginger and mint. A little tart but not really acidic. Easy going yet slow drinking because of the tooth rotting palate. Decent.
Bottle: What an absolute treat! Tart, slightly fruity. Full creamy feel. Does NG make anything bad.

Bottle shared by PinkZambia hazy light golden with light wheaty malt aroma Light tartness...to light I think Very light and mild BW character And peasant clean palate. Delightful but lacking classic Berliner aggressiveness
A really refreshing and tart beer. Kind of weak on the aroma but is perfect in every other sense.

A tasty and mild take on this style. Its cloudy witbier yellow w/ a foamy white head. Its nose has a bit of vinous funk to it in the nose w/ a bit of a fresh, husky grain character. This is light bodied but not at all watery w/ vigorous carbonation. Light tartness seems to bring out the fruity character from the nose while an almost lambic-like phenolic complexity lurks quietly in the background. This style and esp. examples that include some sort of fruit tend to be ham-fisted in one way or the other, either they are straight fruit juice or overly sour and harsh. This avoids those pitfalls and that makes for a very nice beer indeed.

Clear yellow pour with a big single finger head. Aroma of grain and a light sourness. Some grain in the taste, very light and refreshing. Slightly tart. Very nice example of a Berliner Weisse. No lace present. Medium mouth.

Bottle from Santa. Hazy golden pour with a big, rocky, frothy bone white head. Aroma was light lemon, white wine, yeast. Flavors were slightly tart, fresh lemon, cereal malts, simple yet elegant. Lively, champaign like carbonation. Nailed it, good stuff.
Bottle. Man, this is a great example of the style. Light, crisp, slightly tart, and very refreshing. I dig it.

Lighter and less tart than the unplugged release w Pinot grapes. The Riesling grapes were light too - not really imparting any sweetness, just a very subtle aroma and flavor. Just as refreshing, if not quite as complex.

Bottle. Gold color with thick white head and substantial lacing; champagne-like effervescence. Tart fruit candy and yeast aroma with wheat notes. Tart fruit, grape and some cherry, upfront with some bitterness in the finish. Watery mouthfeel especially in the finish. Refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy Straw on white foam. Really nice crunchy wheat juiciness in the mouth. Fades into tart sensations. This is unreal crushable, and just what Id hope for in a NG version of a berliner. Add some Fruit to this thing!
Decent Berliner. Bright yellow. Wheaty nose. Body was light and just slightly tart. Mild citrus taste, yeast, slightly vinous. Just fine.

Clear yellow champagne color with a thick white receding head and striped sticky lacing ..... Aroma is of light lemon, grainy with white grape notes but mostly grainy ..... Taste is of lemons, grainy, green apple and white grapes .... Mouthfeel is tart and sweet .... Has a dry, lingering grainy and tart finish .... Light and refreshing

Bottle pour light yellow with abundant carbonation and white head. Nose tart, white wine grapes, crystal malt, and slight yeast. Taste green apple, white wine, tart up front. Lots of carbonation mid palate. Strong grainy malt mid to late. Back to green apple in the finish.

Smells kind of like apples with maybe a slight bit of citrus and yeast. Tastes almost exactly like it smells. Fruity sweet and sour green apple and citrus (mostly lemon, some lime) taste to begin with, followed by a wheaty yeasty taste. Aftertaste is 10-12 seconds and the same, although the yeasty taste stays on the tongue a bit for another ten more seconds or so. Mouthfeel is spritzy with a soda-like carbonation. It leaves the mouth feeling a bit dry after each sip.
12oz bottle pours a clear, straw gold with some foamy, white head. Nose is mild, lemon and soap but not much else. Flavor is watery, lemon, straw... where is the body? Weak. A rare miss from them.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle.

This is a fantastic example of a Berliner Weiss. Aroma is phenomenal for the style. I didnt get that overwhelming stinky feet smell you get with other versions of the style. Just the right amount of sour balanced nicely with the malt and hops. Great beer!
Mild sour taste just the right amount of sour. Appearance golden color with a nice fluffy white head,lacing is persistent sits well on the palate. New Glarus never disappoints.
Bottle at the DC Expanded Sour Tasting. Brought by maniac, thanks! Light sweetness. some mild malt notes. Not a lot of tartness. Pretty refreshing. A touch more grain than i expected.
Bottle at the DC Expanded Sour Tasting. Shared by maniac, thanks! Hazy yellow with off-white head. Aromas of lemon, citrus. Tastes of lemon, light funk. Light body with a dry finish.
Bottle courtesy of maniac, thanks! Clear very pale yellow color, white head. Aroma of earthy lemon. Taste is similar. OK.

Good for the style but I am not a fan of the beer. Very wheat and fruity for my liking. Pours light yellow with a thick white head. Very carbonated. Got this one from feezo

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale straw in color with a big, bubbly head. Lacto, lemon, feet and licorice in the nose. Some sweet cinnamon apple as well. In the flavor: red apple, a gentle sting of tartness, a little funk, some sweet pear. Low carbonation in the gentle medium body. Incredible balance. Good funk, subtly tart. Exactly what I expect from a Berliner Weiss.

Pours a clear light golden yellow with a big white head. The smell is lactic, grain, lemon. The taste is lemon, grain, lactic ending dry and fruity. Light in body with active. spritzy carboantion. Nice...
Bottle from NG. Poured clear yellow gold with white head. Aroma white wine grape loads of malt little funk tart. Light carb med bod. Light sweet tart taste lil iron hidden fruits

12 oz bottle courtesy of Todd. Pours a slightly cloudy gold color with a medium sized white head. Aroma is tart with hints of sauerkraut, apple vinegar and sour fruit. Taste of sauerkraut, sour apples and vinegar. very Tart.

Bottle from a trade. Shared with Zach. Pours a cloudy hay color with an ample pillow of white head. Aroma is cereal grains, some mild lacto, hay, grass, and a slight funk. The taste is very cereal grain-esque with the lacto on the backend. You get some slight tart fruit and wet grasses. Light body, solid carb. Tart finish. Good balance. Well done.

Bottle thanks to madbeerbaron. Nose has a somewhat muddled lactic note to it. almost a bit of hay with some underlying graininess. hazy, pale yellow with a medium sized white head that dies quickly. Taste is moderately tart with just a hint of sourness catching you in the gills. very clean and well done. Refreshing.

[Bottle (12oz) c/o Glouglouburp] Pours a hazy, quite bubbly yellow-gold with an average size lasting frothy white head. Aroma is citrusy and a bit funky along with wheat, fruit and touches of bubblegum and salt. Tart, citrusy flavour along with wheat, a touch of salt and grain -- light tasting and maybe a bit watery but easy to drink. Average bodied. Pretty good.

Bottle received as an extra. Pours a slightly hazy yellow golden color with a medium plus sized white head. The aroma and flavor have lemony citrus, wheat, some funk, some white grape, mild lactic sour character. Decent body for a low abv beer. Very nice.

Bottle poured a clear yellow with a lasting white head. Aromas of wheat, straw, lemon zest and light yeast. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry lightly tart finish. Flavors of wheat, straw and light lemon zest with a crisp dry lightly tart finish.

12oz bottle thanks to either cbfobes or rdixon77, late summer 2014, I think. Hazy golden pour with a nice off-white head, good lacing. Okay aroma, light lemon, lactic, grainy. Nice flavor, tart, almost sour, mild grain, bread, melds together well, nicely balanced. Tasty.

Bottle shared by Doug 
Clear yellow with a small white head, some lacing. Aroma of cereal and citrus. Flavor of grains, cereal, citrus, lemon and some tartness 
Good
12 ounce bottle. Pours a clear yellow color with a medium white head. A light vanilla woody nose. Sour, lemons, zesty, woody. Very light but good.

Had a bunch of this between July and now (thanks Motortoddhead, for loading us up at Muckfest!), but Im just now noticing its a separate entry from the old Unplugged version. Pours clear yellow with a huge white head. Aroma of funk, creamy wheat, tart fruit and sour lemon. Sour lemon flavor giving way to a creamy wheat finish. A true to style, perfectly balanced Berliner.
Bottle from adnielsen. Thanks Aaron! Minimal aroma of tart lemon and bread. Cereal, tart, lemon, yogurt flavors. Not an overly powerful beer, but solid.

Bottle from Aaron. Pours a very pale straw color with a large head. Aromas of wheat and sour lemons. Taste is tart and lightly sweet. Flavors of sour wheat, with some yogurt twang. Quenching. I dig this.

Nose of barnyard, bret yeast, citrus, faint cheese. Gorgeous pale yellow cloudy pour with a big pillowy heavy lacy head. Very lemony... traces of salt (almost gose-like). Crisp and lively. First thoughts are Fish and Chips as a perfect pairing. Fresh dough. Clean. Wonderful and stylish.

Bottle as an extra in a trade. Hazy gold with massive eggshell white head. Yogurt-covered bread. Lemon peel. A hint of bell pepper. Taste is similar. Light lemon, sour cream. Spritzy, lively on the palate. Light.

[ Bottle ][ ½ of 35.5cl ][ Tasting ][ ][ Tulip ][ 11.25.14 ] Transparent gold, huge puffy white head, dense lacing. Sweet green grape nose, skin but plenty of sugary flesh, light lacto drowned in sweetness, a little green. Faint paint thinner and greenness at front palate, doughy grains with light toast mid, cleaner lactic finish, still considerable sweetness, fizzy in the contrast and thin, sparkling minerality with the short finish leaving lightest grains. 12 oz bottle from trade. Thanks. Pours a hazy yellow color with a big foamy white head that has excellent retention. The aroma is tart with lemons and a trace of sour green apple. The taste is more mildly tart citrus with lemons, limes and most interestingly the foamy head has a semi-sweet meringue effect. This beer is quite literally to drink a lemon meringue pie. The palate is light but effective and the carbonation is lively. Finishes long and sour. Overall: Thanks to whoever sent me this, Ive done so many trades in the past few months that Ive lost track. Gonna have to start labeling the bottles.

Bottle from weihenweizen in trade with CAO Brasilia, golden color with big creamy foam, tasty aroma of wheat and sour lemon, nice balanced flavor of bright lemon, wheat, has a sweet note, quite mild clean sour finish, very good
Bottle. Light golden with very large white head. Aroma of tartness, pear, and some grain. Light body, medium tartness, apple/pear notes, and a dry finish.

Yellow body with a big white head. The aroma has apple, citrus, funk, and a bit of acidity. The flavor is similar, very nice and refreshing. A nice malt character comes through as well. Lots of carbonation and a dry, tart finish.
Catching up on RBAG 2014 notes backlog...bright hazy yellow. Tart/sour lemony citrus, light effervescent palate, dry finish. Very refreshing.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle split with adnielsen. Not a gusher, but big foamy pour. Hazy hay appearance. Aroma is slightly cheesy. Taste is thankfully none of that...but nice bright tart fruits. Bit of wine grapes and dragonfruit. Not super puckering, but a definite pleasant tartness that lingers on the back of the tongue.
Gold and a white head. Nose is yeast, lemon, tart and orange. Easy palate, lightly tart, hint of acidity, yeast, citrus, and orange peel.
citrus, golden, clear, sparkling, rocky head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, medium body, slick feel, lively, long finish,
Fruchtig hefiger, kaum saurer Antrunk. Erfrischender im Mittelteil, säuerlicher, süffig, vollmundig. Leicht zitrusartiger Nachgeschmack. Gut! 7/10/12/11/11/11

12 oz bottle via ericjones. 1062 17:18 stamped on bottle neck. The pour is a clear faded golden yellow with a huge frothy 4 inch white head. The head falls slowly and rockily. The aroma is soft lemon citrus tartness, wheat grain and a whisper of hay. The taste is citric lemon tartness, initially quite strong, than softens nicely to reveal the wheat and hay character. Some grapefruit bitterness becomes evident as the beer warms. The palate is light bodied, with a high level of carbonation and the tart citric citrus lemon finish. Very balanced and full of character beer, quite an accomplishment for a 3% beer.  Really easy drinking, expertly made Berliner. Thanks for the trade on this one Eric.

Tasted on 8/17/14 from a capped 12oz bottle given to me by Chris Drews, big thanks, Chris! Pours hazy pale yellow with a massive, gusher-like, rocky white head that slowly recedes to massive, pillowy lace. The nose is light wheat malt, a touch lactic, with some tart citrus. The flavor is even more tart with a hint of white peppercorn, very bright citrus, and the same light wheat malt from the nose. The body is light with over-active carbonation and a medium tart lemon finish. Very good, but a bit hard to enjoy due to the massive amount of carbonation.

Bottle... Clear light-yellow beer with a small, fizzy, white head. The aroma is subdued, but bready, lemony and acidic. Medium-bodied with jazzy carbonation. The flavor is tangy, yeasty, grainy and lightly sour. Crisp, tart, bready finish. Bottles courtesy of FlandersNed, BVery and motortoddhead!

Great tart aroma, if slightly subdued . Green apples, funk, vinegar, light malt. Hazy yellow with streaming effervescence, thick white head. Tastes great and super refreshing, upfront a light sourness and a ton of carbonation, finishes with a green apple tartness and a hint of sweetness. Great mouthfeel, light bodied and highly carbonated. Rerfreshing and well balanced, if not highly complex. Great beer.
Bottle. Pours a golden yellow, ton of white head. Aroma is tart, wheat. Taste is light, refreshing, tArt, nice. Mouthfeel is light.

From notes I apparently misplaced. Pours a very pale and hazy light straw color with a huge pure white head. Aroma is very sour and citrusy with banana and grapefruit mixed with a slight grain and malt presence. Taste is very tart up front. A lot of sour lemon and sweet grapefruit that blends perfectly with a natural grain flavor.

(Bottle) pours pale, light hazy yellow with a large off-white head. The aroma holds holds minerals, yoghurt, citrus, tart apples, some pipe tobacco, bbq fish, wheat and white bread. The flavour is dry, medium acidic and tiny bitter. Citric and tight malty with mineral notes. The mouthfeel is clean, tart, round and cramy with a near heavily carbonation. Balanced finish. Light bodied.

Bottle courtesy of Summer Santa 2014. Pours hazy pale yellow with a huge frothy and creamy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick lacing and trace on the glass. Smell is slightly sour and tiny malty with wheat crackers, unflavoured yoghurt, moist tobacco, moist hay, yuzu juice, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is sour with wheat crackers, unflavoured yoghurt, lemon juice, yuzu juice hay, dry soil, minerals and lemon zest. Mouthfeel is sparkling, champagne-like, dry, tart and light bodied. Finish is sour with wheat crackers, unflavoured yoghurt, lemon juice, hay, dry soil and lemon zest. The champagne mouthfeel is absolutely killing it and the rest of the beer is pretty much the perfect un.fruited berliner. Wow!

Pours a nice slightly cloudy pale yellow with LOTS of foamy light white head. Wheat, tartness, and funk on the nose; follows onto the palate. Took me about 5 mins to pour it, definitely over carbonated, but still damn tasty none-the-less.
refreshing, tart, a little funky-just goes to show how well new glarus does their thing.
Bottle. Pours hazy gold with a white head. Lightly acidic and lemony with a wheaty base and a nice mildly tart finish. Drinkable and refreshing.

Pours a very light golden yellow, with massive head that dissipates quickly. Very effervescent with loads of bubbles. Sharp, citrusy aroma, with sour banana and other fruit esters. Flavor is quite tart, with a strong lemony-citrus tang, along with many of the same wheat beer flavors/esters, but kicked up a notch. Wish I had some essence of woodruff to mix in or some raspberry juice.

Thumbprint bottle, but it reads exactly the same as the old unplugged entry (berliner with grapes). Not sure why this is a new entry. Regardless: Pours with a hazy yellow hued body and an absolutely massive white head that lasts a bit. Aromas are tart, floral, grainy, mildly funky, lightly vinous, CO2 bite. Lots of lactic yogurt. Flavors are doughy, mildly fruity, funky, vinous, yogurt. Carbonic bite. Pretty nice. Some strawberry fruit notes. Very dry, Pleasant.

Bottle to goblet at the RBAG14 warmup
Lemon, horse blanket/ass/penis...not sure, something horsey at least. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Lemon, orange, a touch of wheat...very fresh tasting.
Lightly hazy pale gold beer, small white head. Palate is light and crisp. Light lemony sourness, touch of sherbet. Light finish with the lemon lingering on.
Bottle - Sour and tart citrus. Hazy gold with a good white head. Tart up front and a very clean, disappears which is too bad. Great and refreshing.

Bottle as an extra in trade. Big thanks for this one. Pours very light yellow, perfectly clear, with a massive white fluffy head on top that goes on forever. Aroma of wheaty funk as expected, some interesting clove and coriander spice, lemon peel, hay, barnyard. Flavor is a twinge of sour lemons on top of some cracked wheat and a bit of zesty spice. A very crisp finish and without the dirty wheat that I usually find unpleasant at the end of the sip for this style. Some definite white wine notes that were picked up even before reading on the label that reislings were used. Extremely light bodied and almost spritzy carbonation. Really more of a sour golden ale than a wheaty Berliner. Lucky for me, that is more to my tasting. Good stuff as usual from New Glarus. If we really want to call this a Berliner, I don't think there is anything close to this. Yum.

Bottle @ home from jarvit .... thx my friend! this is fantastic! .... it pours murky yellow with a large forming white head.... sweet, sour, flowers, fruits, citrus, light soya, light butter, light salty.... very nice...
Hazy golden with big fluffy white head. Tart aroma, lemon. Taste is lightly funk, white grape juice, lemon. Very refreshing on a hot day. Nice stuff

Fresh bottle. Pours clear yellow/gold with towering white head. Aroma is lemon, peach. Taste is mouth-puckering...in a wonderful way! Nice vibrant lemon notes, misc. citrus and some nuttier, earthy wheat notes as well. Really glad I picked up a 4pack of this!

Bottle with Dallas and Jay. Pours a hazy cloudy yellow with huge white head and nice lacing. Aroma is light sour character and lemons. Mouthfeel is super light and sour character upfront followed by light lactic flavor, sour lemons and funky wheat. Really nice, super sessionable Berliner.

A shocker in so many ways! Tart, crisp, springy, fizzy -- just an absolute delight. The sparkling Riesling grapes really sing over the smooth wheat flavor. I served with an alfredo pasta with tomatoes -- delicious!

12oz bottle thanks to Darrel. Pours out a straw color topped with a small head. Nose is lemon grass spice citrus and a nice light funk. Taste is as the nose with more of the citrus notes and a nice refreshing touch on the end.

Syndicate hooked me up with this gem tonight as I was walking out of the Summer Funkfest tasting.... Thanks a bunch Darrel!!

Poured into my Funkfest goblet... pale hazy straw colored brew.. nice white head with good lacing.

Nose is a proper Berliner... floral and lemony... hints of wheat.. smells nicely acidic.

Flavor is fantastic... big clean lactic/lemon wedge acidity combines with a light wheat malt essence.. long and lingering lemon on the finish.

Light body with spritzy high carbonation ... the residual maltiness weighs it down slightly IMHO... but I am nitpicking.

This is amazingly drinkable... I could sup this one all day or at least until my gut broke down or the cavities drove me away.

Thanks again Darrel... I appreciate it!!
Bottle. Pours light yellow with white head. Aroma funky, hay, a tad fruity. Taste medium tart, crisp, funky, lots of carbonation. Very good.

Clear, clean pale and white. Gummy sweety and buzzing fermentage vibe. Building foamy carbonation aids to this weird Fruit Gum sourness that kicks on. Very clean, delicious and tremendous juice-like mouthfeel. Scrambled citrus finish. Bottle, Cheers Scopey!, Alps Game Tasting
Bottle. Pale yellow with white head. Sharp citrus aroma with some earthy yeast. Taste of citrus lemon and earthy yeast. Quite tart. Nice
Bottle at Craigs. Pours hazy golden, hint of dry toffee nose, taste is funky, sour, light fruit, dry, sweet.
bottle at home .. june 2014 ... golden yellow ... big whiote lacing ... soft dry light funk nose ... tart dry zezty orange fruits ... light fruits ...

Pours very light yellow, a bit hazy, huge head. Nose is white grapes, wheat, barnyard, a bit sour, hay, a little lemon, a little sulphur. Taste is wheat, white grape, lemon peel, barnyard/funk a little sour, a lot of lemon on the finish, and also dry at the end. Very alive, bubbly, effervescent. Best example of the style I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

As you open the bottle the foam shoots out here, the beer cannot get into your glass quick enough. The aroma is reminiscent of apples and fresh cut lemons. Pours a tantalizing straw color. Thick head retention, as per the foam that gushes out from the opening. This is a wonderfully balanced berliner weiss with an emphasis on a restrained tartness and refreshing citrus and apple tone. Some banana and sugar on the back end, with a yeasty undercurrent. A superb beer.

Got this thanks to Henshawb. Poured a hazy golden with a huge thick head. Slightly overcarbonated but oh well. This bottle leaked slightly during shipping but still fizzed bigtime when i cracked it. Im wondering if the other bottles are overcarbed or this was the redheaded stepchild. Either way its nice. Nose is grassy funk and tons of citrus. That nose plays out nicely in the flavor with a yeasty/saltiness on the backend but just enough pucker in the finish to tie it all in. I really enjoyed this one

Courtesy of northernbrews
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate sour lemon, light sweaty feet, and faint must. It pours a cloudy dull yellow with a large rocky white head that has great retention. There is a lot of clumpy lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate heavy sour citrus and lemon. The finish has some funky/sweaty notes, must, and a touch of metallic notes. Its light bodied with moderate-lively carbonation. Overall, this is very tasty and crushable. I could do without the metallic notes, but its more sour than most Berliners Ive had, so for the most part the metallic flavor gets covered up.

Nearly clear yellow-gold pour with a huge, pillowy white head that lasts forever and leaves nice sheets of thick lacing. Aroma starts with delicate sour mash tartness, sour floral notes, toasty and floury wheat, lemongrass, a hint of peppery spice, a dry hayfield right after a short rain and some tough to describe fruity notes. Flavor is big on toast, cereal and whole grain wheat flour right away, then comes a flood of delicate, yet fairly intense fruity and acidic floral notes, sort of like rosehips and hibiscus, and some light, untoasted oak notes, toward the finish the acidity grows a bit and the floral and cereal/wheat notes right up to the finish which is mostly clean, but leaves a pleasant floral, tart and mineral aftertaste that remains very inviting. leaving me dying for another sip. Light body, neutral to slightly creamy entry, light, blanketing and sharp carbonation, moderate acidity and crisp, slightly floury finish. A+freaking+mazing. I could drink this stuff all day, at 3%ABV, why not? Surprisingly it remains delicious at any temperature from the fridge right up to room temp, where the flavor opens up and it becomes fairly sweet, though it seems best around 45-50F.

One of my very favorite beers, and perfect for the late spring/early summer. Even with the very gentlest a pours, a massive pillowy head pushes out of the glass. If your glass has one of those little laser-etched bubble-generator things (whats the actual name for those?) in the bottom, dont be surprised if the thick, foamy head continues to billow out into a cone of froth towering over the glass. 

The beer itself is golden-straw colored, almost with an extremely faint tinge of emerald green. It smells tart, very lightly grassy. The taste is crisp and clean, slightly tart and a bit sweet, maybe a bit lemony. Mouthfeel is light and lively with carbonation, coupled with acidic sourness. Overall, you could almost liken it to drinking a Mountain Dew in its palate and tartness, but obviously it is quite different in its flavor. Very drinkable, very refreshing, delicious, and sessionable.

The beer is the color of pale straw, translucent, and highly effervescent. Even when poured carefully a massive, yet delicate looking white head fills at least half of my tulip glass. After a couple of minutes the head settles down leaving behind respectable lacing on the walls of the glass, and a few millimeters of pure white foam that floats on the pale yellow liquid. Its an attractive beer. 

The nose is a combination of overripe lemons, mild Belgian yeast funkiness, and cider-like tartness (notes of sour green apples). The taste is lemony, crisp and tart, but not overly sour. The mouthfeel is light and bubbly from the high level of carbonation. The finish is dry, crisp and clean. Not many flavors linger in on your palate, but the carbonation and acidity leave a slight tingling sensation on your tongue.

Dan Carey and New Glarus have put out a gem here. I love the interplay between the lemons and the Belgian yeast notes in the aroma. The taste is fruity, crisp and refreshing. Id describe the smell/taste as being akin to lemon yogurt crossed with apple cider, with the effervescence of champagne. If you want something with mouth puckering sourness, you might find this beer a little tame, but for those testing the waters of sour beers this would be a good entry point. At 3% abv the effects of the alcohol are unnoticeable to me. Without question Ive found a new favorite Berliner Weiss! I just wish I would have brought home more than a four pack. If anyone happens to be passing through Wisconsin in the near future I strongly recommend you give this beer a try.
Poured from a 12 ounce bottle. The aroma is tart/acidic, green apple, wheat. The flavor is green apple skin/tannic, acidic, cereal grainy sweetness. This is a damn fine Berliner.
Bottle. Pours clear pale yellow with nice white head. Nose is white grape with a little belgian yeast. Taste is sour white grape juice with a little lick-m-aid sour candy.

Really tasty beer. The head keeps growing and growing after pouring. Developed a one inch cone above my glass after a minute or so. Kind of cool. Nice yeasty sourness. I know that sounds gross, but its really good. Little bread like taste as well.

12oz bottle courtesy of TheHOFF43 pours with a pure gold body that supports a bright white head of foam. The aroma offers up grains, lemon and mild funky notes. The taste starts with some lemon tartness mixed with grainy malts and rolling into mild pleasing funkiness. It gets more sour with lemon like citrus to midway adding to the level of refreshment. Nice.

Bottle thanks to hopscotch. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sour, lemon, wheat. Taste is mostly lemon with some sweetness to balance it out. Light palate and a crisp finish. Very nice, refreshing beer.

Bottle split at Bruces pad, big thanks/credit to the Paulometer for supplying a beer he had already rated, 08/04/14. 
Hazed golden yellow with a moderate off white covering which retains.
Nose is tangy fruit, orange peel, apricot, peach yoghurt, spice, vanilla essence.
Taste comprises tangy peach, orange pith, tarte mandarin, straw, light wood tinge, faint acidity.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, crisp close.
Solid refreshing Linner pick me up!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 8th April 2014Tasting at Bruces Pad. Thanks to Paul. Lightly hazy pale gold beer, small white head. Palate is light and crisp. Light lemony sourness, touch of sherbet. Light finish with the lemon lingering on.

Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Paul. Pours clear yellow with a froth white head. The nose has some ripe lemon, a bit of pale bread. Light sweet flavor with mild cereal, further lemony tang, faint salty touches. Light bodied with fine, spritzy carbonation. Very clean to finish, more tangy lemons, light citrus rind, salt, pale bread. Quite nice.
Perfect for the style. Simply one of the, if not THE, best Berliner Weiss style beers I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying.

Bottle via trade. It pours hazy pale gold with a thick white head. The nose is soft, doughy, grain, barnyard, lemon peel, white grape and yoghurt. The taste is crisp, tart, lemon sherbet, lime, yoghurt, hay, light barnyard and dough with a dry finish. Light-medium body and effervescent carbonation. Crisp, tart and so very well balanced. Utterly drinkable. A very good example of the style.
Went through two cases of this stuff. Really nice light lactic character with a bit of lemon and noticeable wheat. Dry and extremely refreshing.
A simple, yet great beer. This isnt my favorite style, but it is my favorite style for sitting and drinking on a hot day when youre really thirsty.

Bottle poured a bright golden color with a thick two finger white head that retained very well. Aroma has tart wheat, grains, straw, and dust. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation medium low. Flavor has a mild tartness, sour wheat, lemon pulp, and straw. Not as aggressive as a lot of berliners but is very drinkable.

Pour is transparent pale straw with a fairly tight egg white head. Nose is lemon, lacto, nice grain behind and grassy through the back. Taste is less lacto, stronger lemon note. Tart finish, grain and yeast less prevalent. Assertive carbonation and light silky body. Solid feel

Aroma: lots of lemon, some sour apple, light malts and faint hints of vanilla.
Appearance: pours a straw color, very slight haze, white head dissipates within a minute or so to a thin film of bubbles, some spotty lacing on the glass.
Taste: lemon acidity is balanced by a touch of sweetness and light cracker malt notes. Sour apple as well, acidity is medium, definitely present but not overwhelming. Very refreshing, with a nice crisp finish.
Palate: lighter body, medium carbonation, effervescent with a semi-dry finish.
Overall: really great Berliner Weisse, thoroughly enjoyed this one.

Nice yellow beer, no sediment, and fizzy white head. Smells tart and Belgian like. Taste is nice and tart. Very smooth though. Great beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from bottle to glass. Light straw hue with fizzy white head that dissipated quickly. Aroma is vinegar, straw, acid, hat, farmhouse. Mouthfeel is great with light body and high carbonation. Taste is dry throughout with a really nice tartness and CO2 sharpness in the following. A slight puckering & dryness in the finish. Overall, this is a fantastic brew!

Pour is hazy yellow with a quickly fading white head. Aroma is faint with notes of yeast, sour grapes, and green apples. Flavor is very acidic with notes of apple peel, tartness, and wheat. Refreshing, but not my favorite style.

Bottle:   Pale yellow, lively carbonation, moderate to large foamy white head, nice lacing.   Tart wheaty nose.   Moderate bitter wheatiness on the tongue.   Starts out with a very slight berry tone, but quickly vanishes.   Not as tart or dry as other examples, this one is a bit more subtle.   Moderate body and mouthfeel.   Soft finish, a little tart and dry.   Cleaner than most, very good example, just a little lighter than others in that its not as tart or dry.   Thanks Bob!

12 oz. bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a hazy / cloudy pale golden with a medium white head. Nose is quite light with subtle notes of lemon, hay and wheat. Flavour is very citric, bringing out mouth-puckering lemon, along with wheat and straw. Mouthfeel is like that of champagne, with a very lively, carbonated one. Great stuff, but seems a tad overrated to me.

A steady pour into my New Belgium globe glass produces a four finger thick (including one above the rime of the glass), pale off-white colored head. The beer is a straw-gold hue that shows a clear, bright yellow-gold hue when held up to the light. The aroma is nicely tart, and has a hay like grain character. Bright lemon like notes with an almost tart apple like edge to it.

The beer has a solid tartness to it that has a nice edge to it without being overly sour. Dried straw, touches of pale cracker, and just fresh threshed field of grain type character. This has a nice prickly carbonation to it that works well with the light body; this is definitely a quaffable beer.

This is nice and clean like a Berliner should be. A good beer to be drinking cold by the pool or at a picnic during the summer all afternoon. Two bottles of these disappear faster than than I could wish for.

12oz bottle served in a DFH shaped pint glass
07/13

A - Pale golden color with some haziness. Hefty white head with strong staying power. Sparkling lacing generously coats the glass.

S - Chalky wheat, earthy dusty hay, but in a clean way, lactic tartness with lemons, dry yeasty bread, floral,

T - Moderate tartness upfront, acidic lemon twang, with a soft dry wheat background, white pepper, dry woodiness, vinous white grapes, hints of dried bananas,

M - Soft light body, moderate lush carbonation lifts it up quite a bit. tart and dry finish.

Very well done! Hits all the marks with flying colors. Great lactic aroma with plenty of tartness on the palate. This one has enough acidity to burn he teeth a bit. Worth seeking out.

Serving type: bottle

09-27-2013

Bottle from Atom. Cloudy pale blond beer with a medium bright white head. Aroma is citrus, straw, wheat, some light funk. Taste is light sweet, light tart, with a very clean finish. Light body, well carbonated. Super refreshing, wish I had access to this in large quantities during the summer.

12 oz bottle, thanks Jeff for sharing. Pours clear pale yellow with a small fizzy head. Aroma is sour lemons and apricots with white grape must. Taste is a sour bomb of citrus fruit. Some light berries and wine too. Tart, dry finish. Even though its more sour than I usually enjoy, it remains pretty smooth and easy to drink. Surprisingly this is my first top 50 berliner, Id like to try more.
From a bottle. One of my favorite session beers. Delicious, slightly sour, very light and refreshing, full of flavor.

Bottle from Scot at The Davis Beer Shoppe. Pours tarnished translucent light gold with a slight white head. Lightly tart aroma. Citrus note. Med minus body. Flavor is very lightly tart. Very lightly bready. Very lightly citrus. So it drinks extremely easily. Light in flavor but somewhat extreme in the nature of the flavor. This is a session beer!

A thank you to my cousin for this one. Big, foamy pour. It has a cidery, lemon tartness that grabbed my attention, but is still smooth and light, without a lot of bite or tingle. It is full-flavored and soft on the palate, and would go down very nicely on a summer evening. An excellent version of the style.

Bottle courtesy of Michael. Thank you! Aromas and flavors of wheat, citrus, and subtle stonefruit (apricot and peach). The Riesling grapes definitely come through, adding more fruit nuances then your typical Berliner. Mouthwatering and refreshing. Wonderful fuller body and balanced tartness. Fine, creamy, full carbonation. Great lingering finish of citrus and mild stonefruits. Glad I got to try this! Thank you! 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

12 oz bottle - pours a light straw . Big citrus aromas . Nice amount of tartness . Some lemon citrus . Very refreshing . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Thanks Northropfrye for sharing this. Pours a hazy yellow with white head. Aromas are lemon, funk, maybe a touch of watermelon bubblegum. Nice sour flavors and a touch of lactose. Good stuff.

Bottle from Dak, thanks man! straw yellow pour, cloudy white head that leaves nice traces of lacing around the edges of my glass. Aroma - herbal, metallic, and lemon citrus, hope this tastes better than it smells. Taste - shizam this is really good, tastes nothing like the aroma which I found to be a bit off putting. Upfront, there is crisp carbonation, once it buckles some nice lemonade citrus comes through, very drinkable...yet another sessionable beer from these guys.
bottle from keir. pours translucent gold capped by a foamy white head. big wheat nose. taste adds lemons and crisp tartness. not overly sour. light creamy body.

Bottle in trade. Pours a hazy yellow with a white head. Nose is prickly citrus, some wheat, some lactic tartness. Flavor is similar with some lemon, some wheat, some lactic. Light in body and a nice base berliner.
Pours hazy light straw, smell wheaty, minimal tart, hay. Taste banana and funk. Very light, small lacto. Ok
Faint funky aroma more vinous than most Berliner Weiss beers I've had and not as tart. Still quite nice. Thanks GV for this one.

Bottling date is smudged.
Appearance: The body is clear with a golden to amber hue. The head is short and dissipates quickly into a white coating that covers the entire top with a creamy ring.
Aroma: The aroma is mild but fruity and spritzy. Some carbonic acid is present with light sulfur, along side bright granny smith apples add a refreshing quality to this. The aroma might be light, but its a joy, slightly tart and hinting at something very refreshing.
Taste: Boy this is interesting. The intro is reminiscent of Perrier water with a fresh lemon, but a mild sweetness of cotton candy sugar underlies this by the mid-taste as granny smith apples overlie it. The finish hints at a little sulfur and a touch of sweetness, carbonic acid is present as well. The finish is abrupt and dry, but theres a very soft lingering cotton candy and tart lemon.
Palate: Light and spritzy, very refreshing.
Overall: This is a very refreshing Berliner. I love the subtle flavors and the high carbonation. This drinks like a fine seltzer water in the best way possible. I would love to have a 6 pack of this on a hot day in the Summer.
UPDATED: JUL 15, 2015 Thanks to iNBe for this. This was excellent stuff. Just tart enough, not overwhelming. Very bubbly. A lot of flavor for the low strength. Serving: Bottle

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2013 [Thumbprint / bottle] bright, sunshine yellow & straw color with a mild haze to it; topped off with a foamy, soapy, bone-white head that retains well & leaves some nice, dripping lace behind. Aroma is musty oak, grains, white grape, straw, green apple skins, & a nice amount of tartness. Taste is perfectly crisp & smooth... White grape & green apple skins, very lightly acidic with a pleasing sourness. Lighter hints of grain, oak, must, lemon, cotton, & a finishing dryness. Nice carbonation snap, thin body, dry finish. To date, one of the best Berliners Ive had, & it absolutely cant be beat for the price. Thanks to Jeff for introducing me to this gem.
[Unplugged / bottle] thanks, Jeff! The Unplugged version, over three years old at this point, was a little creamier & smoother on the palate with not as much sharp carbonation. Big tart & even sweet granny smith apple flavors. Vinous oak & grape notes still present & still pleasantly tart. Possibly a little more sour overall, I still think I prefer the Thumbprint, but this version was very nice as well.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Most Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Wheat, Lemons, Mild Hay

T: Lemons, Mild Citric Acid, Wheat

M: Decent Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Bitter

Overall, a very clean berliner, no thrills or anything advanced, very basic.

Extra in a trade... Awesome! Pours a brilliant yellow blonde with a big white head and leaves lacing. Smell is saltine crackers, lemon, tart. Taste is just the right amount of tart, lemon, a bit of apple, and a nice grainy cracker backbone. Dry finish and good carbonation. Berliners are quickly becoming one of my favorite styles.

Big thanks to artmcd8 for this tremendous brew! Had this at the RB Pgh Halloween Spook-tacular Tasting/Drunkfest fall 2013, nice time at Hornydevils place, thanks James & Michelle! Slight mild tart and sweet perfumy aroma. Wew, this stuff is GOOD! Mild and easy, right up my alley. So easy to drink and so refined, lovely. Refined and frindly. Very nice finish. This beer ROCKS!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
I like this beer quite a bit. It's very subtle and complex with very light flavors. Slightly earthy with some nice wheat notes and some very minimal funk. Has a tart lemony flavor that is soft and doesn't overshadow the rest of the beer. All in all, very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one poured a very very light yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of lemon Peel, cob webs, and light grain. Flavor was spritzy lemiade almost, with mild grain and funk. Solid but nothing mind blowing.

Gold pour with a spritzy white head. Aroma lifts all over the damn place. Lemon, funk, bit o lacto offered. Delicate, yet extremely aromatic brew. Flavor lifts all over the damn place with a medium sour, and a touch of salt. Lively brew, prickly carbonation. Finish is quick, thirst quenching, extremely light and clean. This is the kind of beer I could drink a four pack of in an hour without much thought.

Light yellow pour with a white head. The aroma and flavor have a lot of tart wheat notes as well as a hint of lemon. There is also a bit of spice. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation. Nice, delicate sour. Glad I got to try it.

This beer is the definition of CHARMING. Pours a pale yellow with huge fizzy white head that lasts longer then I would think from a 3% beer. Great lemony tartness and crisp wheat. You need to really chug this one to get its true greatness. I wish I had more.
Pours a pale clear yellow with white head. Perfect amount of tartness. Thin nosh mouth feel. Light carbo.

Bottled: earlier

Looks like a Berliner with light yellow color, three ever growing fingers of bone white suds from the continuous column of bubbles from the most inferior aspect of the glass. Smells like lemons, white grape skins, some funk, a little metal, some grain and lacto sharpness. Soon as the head dies down a hair Im gonna taste it...Nice lightly crisp ale with some pear, some lemon (sweetened) a grain and rice mix, some light tartness and a bit of almost sweetness on the finish. Looks light, but feels heavier than I had anticipated, nice razor carb and a wet finish. I like this beer, I would drink all day from the can on the lakes.
Bottle, good Berliner, not very tart, wheat flavors and lemon dominate, its decent

Bottle thanks to BlackIPA, thanks a lot! Pours a pale yellow with not much head and not much lacing. Aroma is fruity, acid. Some tart wheat notes. Taste is indeed tart with fresh cereals flavors, nice citrus impressions. Body is light, this is really drinkable and refreshing. This isnt complex but still a good berliner weisse!

12oz. bottle. Tart, lightly citric and fruity aroma with notes of lemon, doughy yeast, wheat grain and a touch of dried flowers in the background. Lightly hazy straw yellow in color with a lasting, foamy white head and sticky lacing. Flavor profile is nicely tart with suggestions of green apple, white grape, lemon and pear, along with musty, prominent yeast and touches of wheat malt here and there. Palate is bone dry, effervescent and refreshing, with a very light body and a cleansing feel. This is a very tasty and authentic rendition.

12 ounce bottle

This may be one of the best New Glarus Unplugged / Thumbprint beers to date. In line with the rest of the sour program it is true to the style without trying to become too Americanized. I have not had enough real berliner weisses to know how it compares to the European examples but I do know this - if I could stock four packs of this in my fridge I would have it at all times.

Aroma / Appearance - A transparent golden base bubbles with life under a heavy white head. Lemon, citrus, and a light sour tang permeate the air with a mild texture not unlike tart lemonade.

Flavor / Palate - Smooth lemons sweep across the tongue and immediately brighten the palate. The yeasty transition carries well into a crisp finish with a mild sour feel that is like a glass of fresh lemonade. The result is very drinkable; you could easily have two or three of these with little palate fatigue at all. Grab some while you still can and do not sit on a fine release.

Yellow, hazy appearance and a tall, but quickly fading white head. Some yeast and a hint of sourness, but very little really, one of the most mellow Berliners I have had, and disappointing in its lack of sourness. But it is still a good wheat beer.
Pours pale white gold with a white head. Aromas of yeast, green apple, riesling grape. Bright and acidic with low carbonation. Riesling sweetness, wheat, granny smith. Very nice!
Big thanks to tectactoe on this split. Just what I expected from New Glarus. One of the most drinkable brews out there. Really good stuff.
Des notes de pomme et de vinaigre doux balancé par une effervescence vigoureuse et adéquate. Son corps est mince et larrière goût légèrement chlorophylle est éphémère. Buvabilité aliénante.

12 oz bottle. 1093. (Rileys) Madison, WI.
Clear pale yellow colour with a small white head. 
Mild tartness, citrus and wheat in the aroma. 
The flavour is tart, mildly sour and crisp. Citrus and wheat. 
Well carbonated. Very enjoyable.

Fantastic example of the style. Really enjoyed this one. Champagne like carbonation, a nice tart sour flavor comes through.
